docs.title: Crossroads Inn
docs.text:
At the crossing of the Old North Road and Kings March sits the aptly named Crossroads Inn, a welcome sight to weary travelers. The innkeeper, Orrin Moonshard, is an elderly wood elf with white hair.

On one side, through an inconspicuous entrance, is the Guild Hall, the meeting place of the Guild of the Golden Dragon. The Guild is a loose alliance of adventurers who work together to keep the roads safe from monsters, bandits, and other threats. They also sometimes help neighboring settlers and carry out special missions, which often bring rich rewards. Orrin is the defacto organizer of the Guild, however he never leaves the inn as he is its sole proprietor. He often catches wind of adventures and informs the Guild members. Orrin maintains a flock of messenger pigeons in a coop behind the inn which he uses to communicate with the members and call them together.

The campaign is an anthology of one-shot to 2 or 3-shot adventures. This allows for reduced commitment to make every session, and for more variety at the expense of a big story arc.

docs.text:
In the order of their appearance

First Episode Name Description 1 Orrin Moonshard (Elf) Innkeeper at the Crossroads Inn 2 Marla "Moss-eyes" Vensh Swamp trapper and guide from Rotwood 3 Elaris Andersill (Human Druid) Hut is in Duskmire Forest; makes healing potions 3 Tibbles Gearsprig (Gnome) The party helped get her cart unstuck and they rang her lucky bells and won Inspiration and a Staff of Birdcalls 3 Pagrus "Pag" Geld (Half elf) Freelancer and fisherman in Blackstone Harbor who brought the party to Eirwin Isle 3 Cuda Sandshade (Tortle Druid) Elderly sage who looks after Eirwin Isle 3 Sheila Dawnmender (Elf Cleric) Follower of Eir, goddess of medicine, on Eirwin Isle 4 Dr. Valeria Liva (Elf) Lead scientist at Nexus Lab, was developing an Amplification Serum for Lord Vey 4 Dr. Graddius Stoutbrand (Dwarf) Scientist at Nexus Lab who greeted the party and resigned after the party saved Dr. Liva and Dr. Hague 4 Dr. Jamison Hague (Human) Biochemist at Nexus Lab who tried the amplification serum on himself and partly infected Dr. Liva 5 Elmira Tenk (Dwarven Fighter) Lord Vey's bodyguard who was arrested at the end of the Nexus Prime adventure 6 Borin Ironfist (Dwarven Fighter) Sargent of the Blackstone Harbor Guard, accompanied the party to Mechanus 6 Abagail "Shade" Veil (Half-elf Rogue) Officer in the Blackstone Harbor Guard, accompanied the party to Mechanus 6 Lord Cornelius Vey (Human Artificer) Owner of Blackstone Manor; was building an army of robots at Nexus Prime on Mechanus 7 Vaelith (Giant Owl) Scout for the Thaloriel owl tribe who offered to help the party save Pona the Treant 7 Puna (Treant) Guardian in Duskmire Forest who the party saved from poisoning by Veythar Moldfang's minions 8 Veythar Moldfang (Human Druid) Circle of Spores druid who tried to poison Puna and the Rotwood swamp 8 Beozuk (Shadow Demon) Demon encountered at the spring in Rotwood Swamp where the hydra was poisoning the water

docs.title: Episodes
docs.text:
1. Light the Way - The party assists in illuminating a dark path through Duskmire forest and encounters bandits and a number of pests

  2. Whispers Beneath the Mire - The party assists a swamp hunter who has encountered unnatural creatures. They end up finding a chapel in the town of Marrowfen, now buried in mud, where someone has set up a chapel to the god of death and decay, Moander.

  3. Wave of Destruction - The party assists a druid, Elaris Aldersill, in opening supply lines from the enchanted Eirwin Island. The party discovers a 2-headed Plesiosaurus is guarding the island, and preventing boats from approaching the island. They befriend the beast and the elder and cleric who live there.

  4. Special Delivery - The Guild is asked to deliver a package to Nexus Lab, an arctic research station. They arrive to discover the scientsts have infected themselves with the serum they have developed, and it turned them into ogres. The party manages to make and deliver the antidote, and they resolve to confront Lord vey who is funding the research and may be developing an army of monsters.

  5. Blackstone Manor - The party proceed to Lord Vey's residence where they are met by his sargeant of arms, a dwarven fighter. She asks them to wait in the sitting room and - it attacks them with animated swords and armor and a smothering rug. They explore the Manor and find a portal to Nexus Prime on the plane of Mechanus, where Lord vey is indeed building an army of monsters - robotic ones (constructs).

  6. Nexus Prime - The party returns to Mechanus with two officers from the Blackstone guard. They manage to disable most of Vey's lab and factory, and they find Lord Vey and Elmira. The officers arrest them and return with them to Blackstone Harbor.

  7. Foes in the Foliage - The treant Puna has been poisoned by hooded creatures and Elaris seeks the party's assistance. To make the healing tonic, the party had to obtain a rare flower from the top of the Mother Tree, where they encounter giant wasps, a constrictor snake, and a number of boggles, all while being fired on by dark cultists. They then fight a rot ogre, zombies, and more cultists to rescue the Treant. The evil druid escapes by turning to Gaseous Form.

  8. Garden of Decay Part 1 - The party makes a new friend, Twigs the Fiary Bard. She tells them she tracked the druid, and that he has a hydra in the swamp that is poisoning the water. The party is joined by Elaris and Puna the Treant to confront the hydra. They manage to defeat it, along with Beozuk, a shadow demon who is waiting there, and a number of dretches. When it finally seems safe, they begin to explore and are confronted with a huge sentinel tree outside of the villain's cave.

docs.title: Baked Cod with Bread Crumbs and Butter
docs.text:
adapted from https://cookingwithmammac.com/baked-cod-with-bread-crumbs/ (half recipe)

  • 1 lb cod (or similar fish) fillets

  • 1/2 cup bread crumbs

  • 1/2 cup grated cheese
  • 1 1/2 Tbsp white wine
  • 1/2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1/2 Tbsp fresh chopped parsley
  • 1/2 tsp garlic powder

  • 1/4 tsp paprika

  • 1/2 Tbsp fresh lemon juice

  • 1 1/2 Tbsp butter (I prefer unsalted)

  • Preheat oven to 400; line a baking sheet w/foil and grease w/cooking oil

  • Rinse and dry the cod. Cut into serving portions and place on baking sheet

  • Mix the other ingredients (except for the butter and lemon juice) in a bowl, ensuring bread crumbs are uniformly dampened

  • Top all the fish pieces with the breadcrumb mixture; pat it down and keep piling it all on until no breadcrumbs remain

  • Slice butter into squares and top each piece with a butter square Sprinkle with paprika

  • Bake for fish flakes; the recipe says 25 min but I found 10 minutes was perfect with medium thick fish that had been at room temperature

(v1.0, 24-June-2025)

docs.title: (Almost) Margit's Cucumber Salad
docs.text: This is inspired by Kate's mom, who always made amazing cucumber saled for holiday events.

docs.title: Equipment
docs.text:
• Mandolin
  • Large bowl and spoon

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb seedless ("English") cucumbers (~1 English cucumber)
  • 1 small onion, peeled
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 1 tsp kosher salt
  • 2 1/2 Tbsp red wine vineg

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Slice the cucumber thin into the bowl using a mandolin.
  2. Add salt and sugar and stir thorougly. Let it sit 5 minutes to draw water out of the cucumber.
  3. Slice the onion thin wih the mandolin.
  4. Add the sliced onion and vinegar and stir thorougly
  5. Refrigerate for 10 minutes or several hours before serving

(v1.1, 16-July-2025)

docs.title: Bob's New England Style Granola
docs.text:
This home-made granola is less expensive and, with no added oils, most likely less caloric than what you get in the store. Plus you can customize it with your favorite ingredients!

This is a blend of several recipes I found online, plus I made several batches to fine tune. I just made up the New England part, but it does have maple syrup so why not? Don't even think about using that fake "maple" pancake syrup; if you can't get the real thing I'd try another natural liquid sweetener such as honey or brown rice, agave, date, or brown sugar syrup, adding a bit of liquid if it's too viscous.

docs.title: Dry ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups organic rolled oats (the slow cooking kind)
  • 1 cup organic puffed wheat
  • 1 cup organic puffed rice
  • 1 tsp ground cinnamon

Select 4-6 of the following "fun" ingredients, 1/4 cup each:

  • raw pepitas (often called pumpkin seeds but they're actually from squash) or sunflower seeds
  • chopped raw walnuts, cashews, pecans, almonds, or hazel nuts
  • slivered almonds *
  • raisins, craisins, dried blueberries** and/or cherries

* these tend to overcook so set them aside and add them only for the last 15 min of baking ** these are best added at the end without any baking time

docs.title: Wet ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 egg whites gently stirred
  • 3/8 cup maple syrup, dark preferred
  • 1/2 tsp vanilla extract

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Pre-heat oven to 325 degrees.

  2. Mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl except for any that might overcook such as slivered almonds and dried blueberries.

  3. Mix the wet ingredients to blend them without whipping the egg whites.

  4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and stir with a large spoon until everything is uniformly moist.

  5. Spread the mixture in a cookie sheet and bake for 15 minutes at 325 degrees. (For easy cleanup, line the cookie sheet with aluminum foil.)

  6. Remove cookie sheet and add any ingredients such as slivered almonds that are prone to overcooking. With a spoon or spatula, turn over all the granola, breaking up any oversized chunks, and return to the oven for an additional 15 minutes.

  7. Remove from oven transfer granola to a bowl to cool. Stir in any noncooked ingredients such as dried blueberries. Package in an air-tight container.

docs.title: Why organic?
docs.text:
Did you know that in 2018 the Environmental Working Group (EWG) detected significant quantities of Glyphosphate (Roundup weed killer) in oatmeal? EWG says this is a cause for concern, but the food manufacturers in question claim it's no problem. They wouldn't lie about that kind of thing, right?

You decide for yourself, but we have only organic oats in our kitchen! Bob's Red Mill Organic Old Fashioned Oats are my current favorite.

(v1.2, 16-July-2025)

docs.title: Miso-Glazed Eggplant
docs.text: adapted from https://www.justonecookbook.com/miso-glazed-eggplant/

docs.title: Glaze
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp miso
  • 1/2 Tbsp sugar
  • 1 Tbsp mirin
  • 1/2 Tbsp sake (or more if needed to thin chunky miso)

docs.title: Eggplant
docs.text:
• 3 Japanese eggplants
  • 1 Tbsp toasted sesame oil

docs.title: Garnish
docs.text:
• 1 green onion/scallion
  • toasted sesame seeds

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Gather ingredients. Set oven rack ~7 in from the top heating element and preheat oven to 425. Line a baking sheet with parchment.

  2. Make the glaze. First combine the miso and sugar in a small bowl, then add mirin and sake to make a slurry. Add more sake or water if needed to reach preferred consistency.

  3. Cut stems off eggplants and cut in half lengthwise. Score the inside surfaces with slices 1/8" apart and 1/8" deep; running a mandolin blade over them works well. Score in 2 diagonal directions so the eggplant is covered with a diamond pattern.

  4. Soak eggplant in water for 10 min to remove astringency, then blot with paper towels and place face up on the parchment. Paint the open surfaces with toasted sesame oil, then flip face down on the parchment.

  5. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes until the eggplant fhesh is soft and the skin is slightly shriveled.

  6. Remove the eggplant and preheat the broiler

  7. Turn the eggplants cut side uo and paint with the glaze. Cover the surface completely. You can save any extra glaze for another time.

  8. Broil for 3-5 min until the glaze begins to bubble and carmalize

  9. Serve with the sesame seeds and chopped scallions

(v1.0, 24-June-2025)

docs.title: Kate's Mushroom Gravy
docs.text: Kate found this recipe and adapted it quite a bit so here is the update. I love that you can make a very savory gravy without drippings; this is great on pork roast or turkey!

docs.title: Mushroom mixture:
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter (3/8 stick)
  • 1 1/2 Tbsp fresh garlic, finely minced
  • 1/8 tsp salt

docs.title: Gravy:
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp butter (1/4 stick)
  • 4 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 2 cups homemade chicken stock
  • 3 Tbsp white wine (Pinot Grigio preferred)
  • 1/4 tsp black pepper
  • 1-2 tsp powdered sage
  • Dash of gravy master (optional)

docs.title: Mushroom mixture:
docs.text:
1. Clean and slice the mushrooms about 1/8"
  2. Add oil and butter to a large skillet and melt over medium-high heat
  3. Add mushrooms and cook covered until done through, stirring occasionally. About half way thru stir in the garlic and salt; encourage the mushrooms to juice out
  4. Remove from heat and set side

docs.title: Gravy:
docs.text:
1. In a small sauce pan, melt butter, then add the flour and stir constantly for 1 1/2 min to make a roux
  2. Slowly whisk in the chicken stock, whisking constantly to avoid lumps.
  3. Add the wine and pour off the liquid from the mushrooms; continue to whisk until it thickens uniformly
  4. Add the pepper, sage, and mushroom mixture and cook for 3-5 min over medium-low heat
  5. To get a darker color, stir in a small amount of gravy master

(v1.0, 16-June-2025)

docs.title: Rice in ohaawa pot
docs.text: How to cook brown rice by Ohsawa Pot with Pressure Cooker Cook by pressure cooker which is for all season

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup short grain brown rice

  • 1 1/4 - 1 1/2 cups spring water

  • Small piece of kombu OR Pinch of sea salt

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1) Wash rice and soak in water for 2-6 hours or longer.

2) Place the kombu in the bottom of the Ohsawa pot, then add the rice and water and fasten the lid on the pot.

3) Place the pot inside a pressure cooker that has about one inch of water in it. Fasten the lid on the pressure cooker, and place the cooker over a high flame and bring up to pressure.

4) When the pressure comes up, the flame is reduced to low and the rice is allowed to cook for 30-40 minutes.

5) When the rice is done, remove the cooker from the stove and let the pressure come down. Remove the lid and take the Ohsawa pot out of the cooker. Remove the lid of the Ohsawa pot and use a wooden rice paddle to scoop the cooked grain into a serving bowl and cover with a bamboo mat until serving.

*You may place the chopstick under the Ohsawa pot for noise.

from https://macrobiotickitchen.blogspot.com/2010/11/how-to-cook-brown-rice-by-ohsawa-pot.html - may skip soaking step?

https://what-about-ohsawa-pots.blogspot.com/2022/

docs.title: Equipment
docs.text: • Food processor

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 fillets smoked trout (1/2 lb), skin removed
  • 4 oz cream cheese (half a brick)
  • 2 Tbsp mayonnaise
  • Juice and zest of 1/4 lemon
  • 1 Tbsp prepared horseradish
  • 1 bunch scallions (5 or 6)
  • 2 Tbsp capers in brine, drained
  • 1/2 tsp ground black pepper

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Clean scallions and remove roots and chop into pieces a few inches long. Place in food processor and chop finely.

  2. Add the other ingredients except for the trout and blend thoroughly

  3. Cut trout into 2-3" pieces and add to food processor. Pulse several times until trout is blended but there are still some chunky pieces.

  4. Transfer to a bowl and enjoy

Store for up to a week in the refrigerator
